questions.question: How do I add images to a document?
questions.answer: Call `addOnUISdk.app.document.addImage(blob, attributes)` with image blob and optional MediaAttribute.

questions.question: What parameters does addImage require?
questions.answer: A Blob object is required, MediaAttribute with title and author is optional.

questions.question: How do I get an image as a blob?
questions.answer: Use `fetch(imageUrl).then(r => r.blob())` to convert images to blob format.

questions.question: Can I use local image files?
questions.answer: Yes, use relative paths from add-on root with fetch() to load local images.

questions.question: How do I add animated GIFs?
Why doesn't addImage work with GIFs?
questions.answer: addImage() converts animations to static images; use addAnimatedImage() to preserve animation.

questions.question: What image formats are supported?
questions.answer: AI, GIF, JPEG, JPG, PNG, PSD, PSDT, and WEBP. 8000px or 80MB.

questions.question: Are there GIF size limitations?
questions.answer: Yes, refer to the FAQ section for specific GIF size and weight limitations.
